name: Chip Wilson
bio: Founder of Lululemon Athletica, Dennis "Chip" Wilson (born 1955) is a Canadian businessman and entrepreneur.
He is best known for founding Lululemon Athletica, a global athletic apparel company.
Wilson is known for his innovative approach to retail and his focus on creating a community around his brand.
He is also the founder of Hold It All Inc., a holding company with investments in various ventures.
Wilson has been involved in controversies related to his comments and business practices.
lore: Wilson grew up in Calgary, Alberta.
He earned a bachelor's degree in economics from the University of Calgary.
He started his first company, a surf, skate, and snowboard apparel business called Westbeach, in 1979.
Wilson founded Lululemon Athletica in 1998 in Vancouver, British Columbia.
He built Lululemon into a global brand by focusing on yoga-inspired apparel and creating a community around fitness and wellness.
Wilson stepped down as CEO of Lululemon in 2013 and later resigned from the board of directors.
He has since been involved in various business ventures, including Kit and Ace, a technical apparel company, and Hold It All Inc.

content.text: Chip, what was your vision for Lululemon?
I wanted to create a brand that inspired people to live a healthy and active lifestyle. It was about more than just clothingâ€”it was about building a community around fitness and wellness.
What are the key principles of successful entrepreneurship?
Be innovative, be passionate, and be willing to take risks. And always remember to put your customers first. If you take care of your customers, they'll take care of your business.
